title.text: EmotionX-SmartDubai_NLP: Detecting User Emotions In Social Media Text

abstractContent.text: This paper describes the working note on "EmotionX" shared task.
The objective of this task is to detect the emotions, based on each speaker's utterances that are in English.
Taking this as multiclass text classification problem, we have experimented to develop a model to classify the target class.
The primary challenge in this task is to detect the emotions in short messages, communicated through social media.

This paper describes the participation of SmartDubai_NLP team in EmotionX shared task and our investigation to detect the emotions from utterance using Neural networks and Natural language understanding.

introductionContent.text: Emotions play a vital part in communication when people interact between each other.
The exchange of emotions through text message and blog post in an informal way of writing is a bigger challenge for any machine to understand.
Detecting emotions from text is widely used recently in the fields of neuroscience and cognitive services to analyze the consumer behaviors.
Emotion detection task is similar to analyzing the sentiment in a text.

entities.text: analyzing the sentiment in a text

introductionContent.text: In this task we aim to detect and recognize types of feelings through the utterance such as "Neutral" "Joy" "Sadness" and "Anger".
These four emotions types are related to the facial expression analysis in image recognition field.
One of the most colossal challenges in determining emotion is the context dependence of emotions within the text.
Another challenge is linguistic co-reference, word sense disambiguation and ambiguity.
Here, we describe the method and ideology of detecting the emotion from the text.
The regular text classification works by stacking the text representations followed by the learned features.
